Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2011 12:39PM Mrs_Vino wrote: My hair started falling out on day 13. We went to the lake with lots of friends 4th of July weekend. I was told I had 2-3 weeks before it would start to come out, and planned on shaving it when it did. So I thought us getting home from the lake (day) 15 would be a safe bet. Well, it started coming out by handfuls on day 13, Saturday night. The next day we went out in the boat, and it was flying back on everyone. I started floating on a raft, and as I would run my hands through it, it just kept coming out. I knew we weren't leaving until the next day, and I was so obsessed with my hair, I couldn't enjoy myself. I think the hardest part for me was thinking it was going to go a certain way, and it didn't. Just another thing with this disease you have no control over. Anyway, after a few adult beverages, we went to a friends houseboat, and I sat in a chair surrounded by several amazing friends who took turns cutting, trimming, shaving, and designing until it was all gone. Then we realized nobody on the damn lake had a bandana! So I tied a tank top around my head, and that was that. Once it was gone, I was fine! The thing is, talking to others and asking questions is wonderful. This site has been a true blessing for me! However, realize that your story is your own. Just because it happened a certain way to any number of people, doesn't mean you will have exactly the same experience. That's what has been the hardest for me to learn through all of this awful ride ( not saying journey, because taking a journey should be fun!) with cancer, making plans are almost impossible, there are no exacts, there's wait and sees filled with hope :-). That being said, I will tell you that when. I came home from the lake, I don't know why I was so shocked to go to the bathroom and find my underpants full of pubic hair!! Lol. And unfortunately my leg hair still had to be shaved about once a week, go figure! You will have to update us all on your hairless story. I finished my chemo six weeks ago this past Monday. My hair is starting to fill back in, slowly. I'm over the whole scarf thing! Lol. Never lost all of my eyelashes or brows, just about half, and the brows that I noticed growing back this am are the ones I used to tweeze! Figures...
